title: Yearly subscription
comment: Not mentioned anywhere in the description
Pinboard.in is a paid service, however PinDroid is entirely free and open-source third-party client for it.
Very quick and free of excess feature bloat

title: Needs manual refresh.
comment: My only problem with this app is it not having the ability to be refreshed by the user as well as automatically.  Take a look at the Gmail app. Pull down to refresh and a refresh option in the menu would make it perfect. Just my 2 cents. Thank you for reading!
Really really we'll done.

title: Very nice
comment: This app makes pinboard basically feature complete for my needs. Really nice design and usability.   Also really looking forward to being able to favorite/star articles from the phone, though I see that's waiting on Pinboard API support.

title: Fantastic
comment: This app is great-looking, easy to use, fast, and convenient. It has all the things I want in a mobile client. I'm particularly loving having special tags in the app drawer.

title: It's very good
comment: Needs "pull to refresh" or at least refresh on load.
I've opened an enhancement request for that here https://code.google.com/p/pindroid/issues/detail?id=101.  Thanks!

title: Great app for a great service
comment: Nice work! Updated version looks great on Android 5!

title: Very good
comment: Just the job. I'll please provide a dark theme.

title: Sync still busted
comment: Best pinboard app for Android but with background/automatic sync not working can't justify more than three stars

title: Was Great app
comment: Latest design is messed up on nexus 9

title: It's back!
comment: Very happy to see that this is now working again. New design looks good.
Love the new design

title: The new Google Material Design is fantastic.
comment: Easier to navigate and more consistent interface with other apps, like reddit news.

title: Great redesing
comment: Loved the new design! App works great as always. Thabks for all the work you're putting in it.
Material Design update is great!
Great redesign but it has some authentication issues and asks for my password multiple times. Also, it keeps using internal browser, although I changed that option.

The fix for the internal browser is coming in 3.0.1.  You may be asked for your password unnecessarily if you have moved the app to external storage, or if you revoke your pinboard authentication token.

title: Great new design, same simplicity
comment: Needs to retain contents of input boxes like tags in add bookmark screen when screen orientation changes.

title: Just add login through token
comment: Instead of password. Then it will be perfect. Redesign really rocks!

The authentication token is used internally, your password is only used once to retrieve it, and then discarded and never saved.  You can test this by revoking your auth token, and PinDroid should ask for your password again the next time it needs to hit the API.

title: Fantastic Pinboard App
comment: This app is awesome. Thanks!! UPDATE: the switch to Material Design looks & feels amazing. Still an awesome app, in a flashy new suit.
Nice redesign!

title: Loved
comment: I would be lost without pinboard.

title: Great
comment: New move to material design styling is great, functionality solid, gets the job done.

title: Great update
comment: I love the new material redesign.
I thought this app was dead, but wow is it ever back. Tablet layout needs work.

title: Just about perfect
comment: The new Material UI is well done and solves the biggest issue I had with app: it finally has a decent, well thought-out and appealing interface!  One minor gripe: tags are now listed in the navigation drawer. Pretty convenient, but a pain to navigate if you have hundreds of tags. Maybe a user-definable list of tags instead of just dumping all of them?
Great idea about a user defined list of tags for the drawer.  It's on my list.

title: Essential bookmarking
comment: This recent redesign is gorgeous.

title: Material design!
comment: Great new look of the best Pinboard app, well done dev!

title: You need this for bookmarking
comment: Great new redesign of a superbly functioning app all these years (whose interface was always a bit lagging behind). One little annoyance is the huge list of tags, but that's more or less my own fault. Would love to see a good tag management solution built in though if at all possible.

title: Perfect.
comment: Pindroid's always been stellar as far as functionality, but the UI left a lot to be desired. The new Material UI is fantastic, making it a no-brainer if you use Pinboard.
Lost my login session a few times.

title: Essential
comment: Can't live without this.

title: Money grab
comment: Not free.
PinDroid is entirely free and open source.  There is a donation link in the settings, but donating or not does not affect the functionality at all.
Fantastic

title: Crashes as soon as I try to login
Great!
comment: Never gives me a problem. Saving new links is fast and easy!
Works just as advertised

title: Nice app, doesn't seem to work with Firefox
comment: Haven't used it for long yet, but seems to work well. Can't add bookmarks from all mobile browsers though, that's a little annoying. The default browser and Chrome are fine, but not Firefox, as far as I can tell.

title: Handy reference
comment: Useful integrator of links.

title: Works but needs some UX attention
comment: E.g. sync icons showing on all synced entries instead of just the ones waiting to be synced, some way to search for the intersections of tags, and so on.
Does job, no ads

title: Syncing Error
comment: Once upon a time, this had been one of my favorite apps. It had been easy to use, saved my bookmarks across all platforms, and had totally made the original payment to pinboard worth it. However, due to the current syncing errors, it's next to worthless. The last sync date with my account had been in August, so everything I have saved since then is locked on my phone, the very thing I hoped to avoid. At this time, until the app is fixed, I wouldn't bother with either pindroid or pinboard.

title: Won't sync
comment: I now have a ton of bookmarks stuck on my phone, had no idea they weren't syncing. Considering I use read later for things I need to attend to when I'm on the computer, this is a huge problem.

title: Authentication failure
comment: Getting an auth failure on every login attempt. I'll be back if this is fixed as it looks pretty useful.  EDIT: Fast reply from Matt [thanks!] - Pinboard was having API problems the day I installed. All working now; a quick and easy way to Pinboard URLS. UI needs little bit of work, but I'm being picky.
Pinboard was having issues with the API on October 12, it should be fine now.

title: Major bug on Auth
comment: Can't log in! With correct login info I'm unable to get into my account via the app. Please fix!

title: Solid, but needs attention to UI
comment: This is a decent app but it suffers from glitches and a very rudimentary interface. For example, when reading a bookmark using the Instapaper viewer, rotating your device will cause the page to reload, losing your place. A few well-placed pixels and some smoother interactions would go a long way towards making this good app a great one.

title: Really great!
comment: The one thing I'd like is a more accessible button to refresh (maybe one on the action bar?). Besides that, it's great!

title: Keeps logging me out :(
comment: Aside from that, it's great.  But it's annoying to have to put my password in all the time.

title: Great app!
comment: Great app! Does what it's designed for.

title: Awesome app for aggregation
comment: Simple and effective

title: Best Pinboard app on any platform
comment: I have tried other Pinbaord apps on on devices (iOS, Win8, Android) and this app is the best of all of them. Tag completion, stability, integration... all done excellently!

title: Very convenient, useful.
comment: Truly appreciate this app. Thank you. Please, continue the updates.

title: I like it!
comment: I use PinDroid lightly, mainly to bookmark stuff when I am on my tablet, but I like it because it is transparent. I does its job without getting in your way — sometimes I forget I have an extra app for Pinboard.

title: Best
comment: One of its kind. Be nice if they updated the ui though also pull down to refresh.
I've opened an enhancement request for that here https://code.google.com/p/pindroid/issues/detail?id=101. Thanks!

title: does what it says
comment: easy to search pindboard bookmarks.  internal browser can be improved, may be instapaper view would be easier.

title: Very good pinboard app
comment: Since moving to Android from iOS pinboard has become much more useful with the intent based share feature in apps combined with this client.

title: Doesn't Work w/ Samsung SCH-S720C
comment: Google Play says it's compatible but everything is just blank. Disappointing.

title: Great app
comment: Easy to use and integrates with my favorite bookmarking app seamlessly. Thanks for the great work!

title: Great companion to Pinboard
comment: So far, so good.  Very useful for accessing your Pinboard links.  Can't beat the price.

title: Would like to add Notes
comment: This app is great. Would have given five stars if there was a way to add and edit Notes. I can only view them.
I would too!  However, the Pinboard API only supports viewing them at the moment.  Whenever they add the ability to add notes, I will implement it in PinDroid.

title: Doesn't work on Nexus 7
comment: The fit and finish of the app looked great for the 2-3 minutes I played with it. However, upon loading the "Bookmarks" screen, I noticed 2/3 of the screen was dedicated to a preview I would never see, as I'd set Pindroid to load bookmarks in the browser. When I clicked a bookmark, pindroid launched chrome, and now every time I try to run pindroid or switch back to it, it promptly reloads my bookmark in chrome. Uninstalled.

title: Rallye good, but the 1x1 widget is missing
comment: I would have given 5 Stars but with the last update the 1x1 widget with the indicator for the unread assets is missing....  Is it possible to get it back?   Thanks
The 1x1 widget is back, and better than ever!  You can now choose between several functions for the button, including unread bookmarks with the count.

title: Excellent
comment: Pinboard and pindroid easily make the best bookmarking solution. I wish I'd found them earlier.

title: Authentication exception
comment: Won't authenticate

title: Nice tool
comment: Yesterday I couldn't get the app to log in to my pinboard account, probably a connectivity problem, because today it worked.
Won't authenticate

title: Can't turn off preview
comment: Not a fan of the default split screen preview rather than opening in the browser proper - feels intrusive and can't turn it off. Help!

title: Does what it says on the box!
comment: Easy access to my bookmarks and the new ICS touches are appreciated. Thanks for all your hard work!

title: What happened to Instapaper?
comment: The version released today no longer goes to Instapaper when you long-click a "to read" entry and choose Read. This used to go to the Instapaper website with the URL filled in and nicely formatted. Is this intentional?

title: Good
comment: Wish there was a "sync at startup" option instead of constant syncing, though.

title: Stopped syncing
comment: Not working any more. Saving on my phone but not sending to pinboard despite set up to sync.

title: Good
comment: Works well

title: Perfect
comment: Looking forward to the tablet-optimized version.

title: Saves things locally, but won't sync
comment: It does a good job of saving things locally, but hasn't synced with the server in weeks, and the "Sync Now" option does nothing.

title: Exactly what I wanted! Great app
comment: Works perfectly and quickly, picks up titles on most pages and handles tag completions quite well. Integrates bookmarks into global search (enable in options in Google widget). Easy to save bookmarks quickly (about half a second if you need to wait for app to load title) Option to display bookmarks with Instapaper-formatted view. Nice widget too, quite visually attractive and functional.

title: chen
comment: works great

title: Finally! Working Pinboard access on my phone!
comment: I love Pinboard, and I'm glad to be able to finally save bookmarks to it from my phone! New update Mar 6 2012 fixed crash-on-launch problem for me.

title: I love this app!
comment: Searched through several pinboard apps and liked this one the best. I use it all the time. Great widget. Reliable. No issues. I'd pay money for this.

title: Great tool!
comment: Does exactly what it should. I love Pinboard as an archive tool, & the app is perfect for quick saving, tagging & retrieving of links, like having a custom library of bookmarks at your fingertips.

title: Great
comment: Love it.I use this and the site all  the time.

title: UI a bit ugly
comment: Syncs fine, but the text links in the UI are a bit ugly.

title: Sync broken
comment: Does not sync on HTC Desire...

title: Awesome.
comment: Works great! Two-way sync using Pinboard; fast, simple UI. Developer is quick to respond to inquiries about bugs & feature requests. Moto D2, CM7.

title: Rocks
comment: Great, simple. Easily post to pinboard.

title: Android
comment: Cannot login

title: Doesn't sync FROM Pinboard.
comment: Only to. Which isn't what I expected. And force closes all the time. Pity because good UI. Will keep an eye on this. Hope to add stars. HTC Desire
crashes repeatedly even without being used.
Uninstalling since I prefer not to sync.
I like this app, but since the last update I can no longer save bookmarks. Please fix!
Works great now on my Thunderbolt. I like this even better than Diigo for my bookmarks.
akshay: why would you downvote the app, just because you can't figure out how a browser works?
How to sign up :-/
Super simple. No problems anywhere with my Incredible. Love it.
Crashes every time I sync on my Droid Incredible running 2.2.
Awesome. Love the widget.
Browsing popular bookmarks would be great.
not able to sync, therefore useless
One of the best functioning apps I've used This is an app that just feels well thought out. Works as advertised. Does its job. Has a nice widget too.
Frequently overloads the processor on my Droid.
Just awesome!
so very useful. love the share to pinboard feature in stock browser.
Awesome, title fetch now does Unicode!
Thank you very much for this application, I find it very useful. Works great.
fantastic app! force closing issues fixed shortly after reporting. thanks!
Droid X, no problems. Get new features and any reported issues fast. Great app.
Note support would be great.
Working flawlessly. Rapid updates with new features.
Looking good
Pinboard is so much better than delicious. Also, has two dedicated developers that are focused on making a great service.
Does exactly what I need it to.
